question.body: Which of the following is not properly matched with its description?

multiple_choice.choice: The opening for the aorta is found in the right ventricle.
Papillary muscles are attached to the AV valves by the chordate tendinae.
The opening for the pulmonary veins is found in the left atrium.
The opening for the superior and inferior vena cavaes are in the right atrium.

response.feedback: Correct. The opening for the aorta is found in the left ventricle, because the aorta is the largest artery and is responsible for transporting blood to the rest of the body.
Incorrect. The papillary muscles are attached to the AV by the chordae tendinae which keep the cusps of the AV valves tethered to the ventricles.
Incorrect. The pulmonary veins bring blood back from the lungs to the heart and deposit the blood in the left atrium.
Incorrect. The openings for the superior and inferior vena cavas, which bring oxygen-poor blood back from the body are found in the right atrium.
